intro: Kjellbergiodendron celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes beech, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments at high elevations. Its bark is thick and corky, providing some protection against environmental stressors. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
